reasoning: The interaction feature 'striking_differential_x_opponent_quality_diff' achieved the intended balance, improving both primary goals simultaneously. Top 25% accuracy improved from baseline 0.7785 to 0.8121 (+3.36 percentage points), which is the primary objective. Critically, underdog top 25% performance also improved: accuracy increased from baseline 0.591 to 0.609 (+1.8 pp) and ROI improved from 0.52 to 0.63 (+0.11). This contrasts with iterations 1-3, which improved Top 25% accuracy but degraded underdog performance. The selective activation of the interaction feature (requiring both striking advantage AND quality advantage) successfully identified elite-level favorites without over-penalizing underdogs, demonstrating that interaction features can be more balanced than direct amplification approaches. Overall accuracy is slightly down from baseline (0.6667 vs 0.67, -0.33 pp) but improved from iter 3 (0.6599), and the key metrics show strong gains.
next_steps: Continue building on this success - interaction features that require multiple conditions appear to be more balanced than direct amplification
Consider exploring additional interaction features that combine different aspects (e.g., age_x_opponent_quality to reduce age penalty for elite fighters)
Monitor whether the threshold-based feature approach (iteration 5 from plan) could further improve Top 25% accuracy while maintaining underdog performance

The model now has Top 25% accuracy of 0.8121 and underdog top 25% ROI of 0.63, both significantly improved from baseline. Future iterations should focus on maintaining this balance while potentially pushing Top 25% accuracy even higher if possible without sacrificing underdog performance
